description.narrative: The projects overall objective is to mobilise youths energy, mobility, open-mindedness and dynamism as a potential positive force of countering violent extremist influences and narratives in the target communities affected by radicalisation.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1.4 In Turkmenistan 1000 young men and women empowered and helped to overcome social exclusion 1.4.1 Number of young people trained on peace and security issues, conflict prevention and conflict mediation - 300 1.4.2 Number of young people raised awareness about the national policy and law-making process - 300 1.4.3 A sample survey to identify employment inspirations to be conducted - 0 1.4.4 Number of Youth Centres with enhanced capacity to provide social services to at risk groups - 2
Output 2.4 Employment opportunities for 1 000 young people in 5 cities of Turkmenistan created 2.4.1 Number of young people employed by local municipalities for public works - 100 2.4.2 Number of former prisoners employed by local municipalities for public works - 70 2.4.3 Number of young people engaged in entrepreneurship/self-employment - 100 2.4.4 Number of public employment services staff trained - 10 2.4.5 Local labour market assessment and government specialists trained - no

Output 1.4: In Turkmenistan 1000 young men and women empowered and helped to overcome social exclusion 1.4.1.In Turkmenistan 1000 young men and women empowered and helped to overcome social exclusion - 350 1.4.2 Number of young people raised awareness about the national policy and law-making process - 350 1.4.3 A sample survey to identify employment inspirations to be conducted - 5 1.4.4 Number of Youth Centres with enhanced capacity to provide social services to at risk groups - 2
Output 2.4: Employment opportunities for 1 000 young people in 5 cities of Turkmenistan created 2.4.1 Number of young people employed by local municipalities for public works - 200 2.4.2 Number of former prisoners employed by local municipalities for public works - 150 2.4.3 Number of young people engaged in entrepreneurship/self-employment - 200 2.4.4 Number of public employment services staff trained - 15 2.4.5 Local labour market assessment and government specialists trained - yes

Major achievements under Output 1.4:
 Online School project was launched in Turkmen and Russian languages in national online media to provide text and video trainings and advice on various topics following the interests and requests from young people and received 18,055 viewings.  166 service providers and decisions makers, including Youth organization, Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Population, General Prosecutor’s office, Ministry of Internal Affairs, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Hakimliks of pilot cities, Ministry of National Security, mass media, Women Union, police from pilot cities raised awareness on PVE issues.  Coordination committee meetings launched in each pilot city to meet quarterly to coordinate and support vulnerable groups of young men and women. Regular involvement of local governance and service providers in the project activities and meetings with young people: specific focus on the needs of young men and young women in every pilot city.  2,036 young people: 973 men (48%) and 1063 women (52%) directly benefitted from participating in project activities in 6 pilot cities, that included awareness raising and capacity building activities, apprenticeship and grant programmes, as well as regional youth exchanges.  12 surveys, research and focus group discussions conducted to study situational analysis of young people and hear the voice of young people on inclusive employment opportunities, vocational education, employment opportunities and state support programs for youth.  A mobile application developed jointly with the Youth organization to inform young people on activities held by the Youth organization.  6 Resource rooms for young people in pilot cities equipped with computer and training equipment; 2 resource rooms in Tejen and Dashoguz pilot cities furnished.
Major achievements under Output 2.4:
 In total 1,294 young people (527 men and 707 women) were supported and opportunities created for their employment such as consultations on employment provided by employment departments, vocational education in formal schools, apprenticeship with private mentors, online job skill trainings, support to self-employment and opening new small businesses by providing instruments and equipment. Additional 60 jobs were created by the new businesses opened with the project support.  Active Labour Market Programme introduced and includes: profiling methodology to assess the real-life situations, needs, motivation and interests of unemployed young people and Case management methodology.  96 specialists of Labour and Employment departments, business school trainers built their capacity by taking courses in methodologies for Active Labour Market Programme, Basics of Business and Writing Business Plans, Psycho-social support to vulnerable population, Labour market research and analysis.  2 Labour market researches completed that covered Dashoguz and Mary pilot cities.  Website of the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Population improved by including interactive and informative content for users.  A mobile application “Iş gözle” (Job Search) for Android versions of cellphones linked with the Employment portal of the Ministry was developed. Unemployed young people have an opportunity to search jobs using the application.  6 Employment departments in pilot cities were equipped with computer and training equipment; 3 resource rooms were remodeled and opened in employment departments in Turkmenabat, Turkmenbashi and Dashoguz pilot cities.

1000 young men and women empowered and helped to overcome social exclusion
1.4.1 Number of young people trained on peace and security issues, conflict prevention and conflict mediation - 350 1.4.2 Number of young people raised awareness about the national policy and law-making process - 350 1.4.3 A sample survey to identify employment inspirations to be conducted - 5 1.4.4 Number of Youth Centres with enhanced capacity to provide social services to at risk groups - 2
Employment opportunities for 1 000 young people in 5 cities of Turkmenistan Created 2.4.1 Number of young people employed by local municipalities for public works - 200 2.4.2 Number of former prisoners employed by local municipalities for public works – 150 2.4.3 Number of young people engaged in entrepreneurship/self-employment - 200 2.4.4 Number of public employment services staff trained - 15 2.4.5 Local labour market assessment and government specialists trained - 0

Major achievements under Output 1.4: • UNDP launched a programme for Youth organization specialists to provide support and conduct soft skills and critical thinking trainings for vulnerable groups of young men and women. • UNDP jointly with Hedayah Center contributed to raising PVE awareness among top level government officials and local governance agencies in pilot communities. • 115 young men and women participated in 3 roundtables on UNSC 2250 Resolution on Youth, Peace and Security that took place in pilot communities (Ashgabat, Tejen and Mary cities). • Discussion platforms launched in pilot communities between vulnerable young men and women and local governance on the needs, interests of young people as well as their expectations and role in the development of their communities. • Situational Analysis on Youth in Turkmenistan A UN Inter-Agency Initiative was conducted jointly with UNFPA, UNICEF in cooperation with the Government of Turkmenistan.
Major achievements under Output 2.4: • A programme of coordination committee meetings was launched in 2019 to cooperate on providing support to vulnerable groups of young men and women with the participation of key stakeholders in each pilot city. The issues of youth employment, job skill trainings, social support, opportunities, needs and concerns of young men and women were discussed at these meetings. As of December, three coordination meetings were held. • UNDP launched active labour market programme, the methodology of profiling and case management for inclusive employment in pilot communities with the endorsement and support from the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Population. • UNDP launched a self-employment programme for young men and women that included training on developing entrepreneurial skills and development of training materials. 138 young unemployed men and women took part in trainings, 67 of them were women, 6 – former prisoners. • A grant programme for young people was commenced in pilot communities. • A mobile application for Android versions of cellphones on employment linked with the Employment portal of the Ministry was developed. All unemployed young people will have an opportunity to search jobs using the application.
